intro: Siphoneranthemum polyneurum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved siphoneranthemum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
